Results show that SUMO-4 is expressed in normal placental development. SUMO-4 expression was increased in pre-eclamptic placentas and in models of oxidative stress and hypoxic injury suggesting that SUMO-4 hyper-SUMOylation may be a potential post-translational mechanism in the stressed pre-eclamptic placenta.
Both donor and recipient SUMO4 rs237025 polymorphisms contribute to the development of new-onset diabetes mellitus after liver transplantation.

Donor SUMO4 rs237025 genetic variant was associated with higher tacrolimus C/D ratios in the early period after liver transplantation, which might be related to the down-regulation of CYP3A5 enzyme through the NF-kB signalling pathway.

BP.term: regulation of canonical NF-kappaB signal transduction
regulation of protein localization to nucleus

name: small ubiquitin like modifier 4
other_names: SMT3 suppressor of mif two 3 homolog 2
SMT3 suppressor of mif two 3 homolog 4

kegg.name: Fluid shear stress and atherosclerosis - Homo sapiens (human)

summary: This gene is a member of the SUMO gene family. This family of genes encode small ubiquitin-related modifiers that are attached to proteins and control the target proteins' subcellular localization, stability, or activity. The protein described in this record is located in the cytoplasm and specifically modifies IKBA, leading to negative regulation of NF-kappa-B-dependent transcription of the IL12B gene. A specific polymorphism in this SUMO gene, which leads to the M55V substitution, has been associated with type I diabetes. The RefSeq contains this polymorphism. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
